title: How would you classify Scala?
content:
How would you classify [Scala](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430115736/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/FF%252BScala)? Humanist?

Thanks

 [‹ Which one would be more comfortable to read?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430115736/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31956 "Go to previous forum topic") [What are the dullest fonts around? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430115736/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27800 "Go to next forum topic")
author: JB01

comments.content: A Garaldine serif with a complementary humanist sans serif.

_Garaldine serif_

I’m not familiar with this term.

<cite>I’m not familiar with this term.</cite>

It’s a portmanteau Garalde and Aldine, see Will Hill’s _The Complete Typographer_, I picked it up from one of my professors. Garalde does the job just fine, but those Brits are always tacking more stuff on to words...

_those Brits are always tacking more stuff on to words…_

not in this case, James ; ) Call it what it is and have done with it.
